Description: command used to clear the saved tokens in cache
command to get id_token or access_token through OpenID connect or implicit grant flow

Sample Usage:
Get-AccessToken -Resource $Resource -ClientId $clientId  -Tenant $Tenant -redirecturi $RedirectUri -scope $scope -verbose
Get-AccessToken -Resource $Resource -ClientId $clientId  -forcemfa $true -verbose
Get-AccessToken -Resource $Resource -ClientId $clientId  -savetocache $true -verbose
Get-AccessToken -Resource $Resource -ClientId $clientId  -usedevicecode $true -verbose
Get-AccessToken -Resource $Resource -ClientId $clientId  -IncludeRefreshToken $true -verbose
Get-AccessToken -Credentials $credential -tenant $tenant -redirecturi $redirecturi -verbose
Description:
command to get access token. Default is using authorization code flow. 
Use -savetocache to store the token in cache.
Use -usedevicecode to get access token via device code flow.
Use -IncludeRefreshToken to request refresh token too
Use -forceMfa to force the authorize using MFA
Use -credentials to use a provided credential to request token

command to to get access token by using a new refresh token for AAD graph (https://graph.chinacloudapi.cn)
command to get access token through on behalf of flow
command to get access token using a refreh token
command to list all current stored tokens in cache
command to get the current default cloud resources
Command to check out if the giving domain/user UPN is a dual federation tenants and return all tenant ID

Sample Usage:
Get-OpenIDConfiguration -domain contoso.com
Get-OpenIDConfiguration -domain contoso.com -cloud "AzureChina"
Get-OpenIDConfiguration -domain contoso.com -appid $appID
Description: Command to get openId know configuration for a giving domain or user UPN
Command to get tenant ID based on giving domain/user UPN/access_token
commnd to set the default cloud (support for AzureChina and AzurePublic currently)
